valueString:
The Russell H. Morgan Department Of Radiology 
               and Radiological Science
     The Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore MD. 21287


 
 


BREAU, JOHN 


Exam Date: 11/29/2012   09:02  ORD #90001 Accession #10460659
History Number: 5119345     
Age: 40Y  Sex: M Race: W
Requester: JAISHRI O'NEILL BLAKELEY MD




RESULT: 


MRI of the chest, abdomen, pelvis and lower extremities


INDICATION: Schwannomatosis


TECHNIQUE:  MRI was performed on a 1.5-Tesla system using coronal T1 pre- 
and postcontrast, diffusion sequences and coronal T2 space.  Contrast 
material was administered. 18 cc Magnevist


COMPARISON: None


FINDINGS:


ALIGNMENT: Maintained


FLUID:  No fluid collections


JOINTS: Limited evaluation for internal derangement given large 
field-of-view


MUSCLES: No denervation changes


TENDONS:  Intact


BONES: Unremarkable however only fat-suppressed sequences performed


VASCULAR: Major vessels patent


NERVES: Bilateral enlargement of the T1 nerve roots measuring 2.3 cm in 
largest dimension, bilateral enlargement of the T2 nerve roots ( right 
larger than left) measuring up to 3.8cm in largest dimension, bilateral 
enlargement of T3 nerve roots measuring up to 2.2 cm in greatest 
dimension, 7 mm enlargement of right T4 nerve root, 9 mm enlargement of 
left T5 nerve root, apparent 9 mm enlargement of the right C8 nerve root 
however the neck is only partially imaged; all of these lesions 
demonstrate minimal enhancement postcontrast; spinal cord appears 
unremarkable.


OTHER:  Limited evaluation of the solid organs of the abdomen are 
unremarkable


IMPRESSION: 
Multiple nerve root lesions in the upper thoracic region demonstrating 
minimal enhancement in keeping with schwannomatosis.




..: Created By AKEL1 . Last update: Nov 29 2012  3:30P.


ANDREW KOMPEL MD


 


IMAGES AND INTERPRETATION PERSONALLY REVIEWED BY:


AVNEESH CHHABRA MD


RESULT ELECTRONICALLY SIGNED
